column1: The Pit Room////The first time I visited last year
column2: this was fantastic and on par with Gatlin's. I could see why this BBQ joint was on Texas Monthly's top 50 BBQ places to eat in the state. The brisket was moist and easily fell apart
column3: to the point where I'd give this place four stars. But then I returned earlier this year
column4: and the brisket was really dry. I needed a knife to cut through the slices (blasphemy for BBQ!)
